attributes.title: Physical Stock Take
attributes.description:
After stock reconciliation it was found that physical stock counted for all stock items matched with the book balance except for the following items which had a minimal variation: -After stock reconciliation it was found that physical stock counted for all stock items matched with the book balance except for the following items which had a minimal variation: -After stock reconciliation it was found that physical stock counted for all stock items matched with the book balance except for the following items which had a minimal variation: -After stock reconciliation it was found that physical stock counted for all stock items matched with the book balance except for the following items which had a minimal variation: -After stock reconciliation it was found that physical stock counted for all stock items matched with the book balance except for the following items which had a minimal variation:After stock reconciliation it was found that physical stock counted for all stock items matched with the book balance except for the following items which had a minimal variation: -

v  Packing Materials had a cumulative variation of 656 pieces.

v  Bread stock had a negative variation of 38 loaves.

v  Utto had a positive variation of 3 liters
attributes.recommendation: The branch management needs to tighten bread control and poly bags controls to reduce the variation noted.
attributes.effect: Zero and minimal stock variations is an indication of strong stock control.

value:
We will follow up on the stock items with variations to ensure those variations are eliminated.

We will liaise   with sales team to ensure route crates balances are cleared

Frequent spot checks will be put and follow up on polybags consumption to make sure no variations in the branch.

Crates balance mostly are left in the supermarkets with our products as per the sales representative report.
In a prior report dated 25th Feb 2025 Bread had -32.75 loaves, Utto had -0.761 Litres, white flour had -5.075 kgs, and poly bags had +547 pcs
Previous
A physical stock take of all items in the branch was conducted on 12th April 2025.
Stock controls put in place were strong and effectively working.
Operations/Production Department
The aim was to assess whether the physical stock counted matched with the book balance and whether the internal controls put in place were effective and working properly.

attributes.title: Bread Weight
attributes.description: From the sample size taken underweights were noted across all the varieties sampled. The table below illustrates the findings: -
attributes.recommendation: Bread weight control needs to be enhanced from dividing area to packing section to ensure that loaves packed are of the required standard weight.
attributes.effect: Packing underweights is an indication of noncompliance to weight standards and this could expose the company to heavy penalties if caught by the weight and measures officials and could cause reputation risk

value: We will put in more checkups on weight to avoid being underweight.

More samplings will be done from time to time due to frequent change of flour used.

Also, more efforts will be put in slicing section to make sure bread is sliced and packed in time to avoid overcooling.

Slicing machine settings to be monitored to avoid chippings of bread leading to underweight bread.

During the prior audit dated 25th Feb 2025, From the samples picked, bread underweight percentages were noted as follows; 400g CT - 35%, 400g Grande – 9%, 400g Akyida – 31%, 600g BT - 21%, 800g CTW - 15% while 1.5kg W had 36%.
Previous
A sample of bread produced, packed in the branch and ready to be distributed in market were randomly selected and weighed.
The branch did not comply with bread weight controls, and this indicated that controls were not strong enough
Operations/Production Department
The aim was to check whether bread sent to the market was of the minimum weight of 200g, 400g, 600g. 800g and 1,5kg as set by KEBS.

attributes.title: Bread Damages
attributes.description:
The audit sampled period was from 1 March 2025 to 11 April 2025. The findings were as follows: -

v  Production damage was averaging at 0.22% of the production damage which was above the set limit

v  Market damage stood at 0.66% of the total sales.

                           Table 1 Analysis of Production Damages

                     Table 2 Analysis of Market Damages
attributes.recommendation: The branch management should control damages by ensuring bread produced is of standard quality by following set procedures to reduce production damages and market returns
attributes.effect: Production damages and market damages surpassed the set limits. This resulted in cumulative revenue loss of Ksh. 38,372.00

value: We will try our best to control   bread damage to the acceptable levels.

The branch has improved on damages controls, and we will work hard to make sure they are within the set limits.

Supermarkets damages are mostly due to expiries. I will liaise with the sales representative to control orders to avoid oversupply.
During the prior audit it was noted that production damages were 0.31% of the total production while market damages were 0.50% of the total sales.
Previous
An analysis of production and market damage was calculated.
From the analysis bread damages exceeded the set limit and this indicates that branch was not following up the production procedures.
Operations/Production Department
The Production and market damages were analysed to establish whether they were within the set limit of 0.20% and 0.50% respectively.

attributes.title: Mixing Chart Analysis
attributes.description:
The following were the findings.

v  Utto consumption stood at 100 %.

v  The average yield was 190.34 loaves per bag.

v  Average production was 51.57 bags per day, this represents 63.67% of the set target of 81 bags.

v  No remix was noted during the audit period.

v  There was accuracy of figures transferred from mixing chart summary to cash flow for the period audited.

The table shows the summary findings of the mixing chart
attributes.recommendation: The branch should strive to ensure that they attain their production target by boosting sales.
attributes.effect: Production target was below the set target, and this indicates that the branch capacity was underutilized.

value: Production is below the set target because of low sales that prompt shift cuts to control bread balance.

The branch targets achievement has always been affected by low sales.

Sales representatives are urged to open more depots to increase sales.

During the prior audit, it was noted that, utto consumption stood at 100 %, average yield was 190.41 loaves per bag, and average production was 44 bags per day.

Remix were 283 tins of 400g.
Previous
An analysis of both mixing chart and mixing chart summary were done for a period of 41 days from 1st March 2025 to 11th April 2025.
Production procedures were being followed to the letter.
Operations/Production Department
The aim was to calculate the average yield, Utto consumption, checking for time lags as well as the presence and magnitude of remixes.

attributes.title: Cash Count Analysis.
attributes.description:
It was found that the cashier accounted for all the cash balance. The total cash count was Ksh.1.657.00

There were two pending IOU’s amounting to Ksh. 16,600.00.

At the time of the spot check there was no cash for NSSF or SHA
attributes.recommendation: The branch should continue to advocate for good cash asset controls.
attributes.effect: The cash office is adequately managed thus the cash at the branch is adequately safeguarded.

value: Cashier as done a good job and should keep it up.
Cashier he is encouraged to maintain the good controls.
In a prior audit report, all the cash was well accounted for.
Previous
Internal audit conducted unannounced cash count in the cash office on 10th April 2025.
The unannounced cash count conducted didn't found any significant discrepancies or irregularities. Internal controls related to cash handling appeared to be functioning effectively.
Operations/Production Department
The aim was to ensure the accuracy of the financial records.

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description: It was noted that the production efficiency was 4.23 bags per production worker, and the standard rate achieved was below the set limit. The table below illustrates the findings.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should put more effort into achieving the set target and this can be achieved by assigning the right number of workers and ensuring that they achieve the set targets
attributes.effect: Production efficiency was slightly below the set target, and this implies that the labour force was underutilized

value: Production efficiency affected by shift cuts.
To do more follow-ups in production to make sure efficiencies are achieved even in the time of shift cuts.
In prior audit production efficiency stood at 4.37 bags per production worker.
Previous
Production efficiency was calculated for a period of 42 days from 1st March 2025.
The audit revealed that branch didn't effectively and efficiently utilize the labour force.
Operations/Production Department
The aim was to determine if the production workers hired were achieving the set production efficiency of 4.30 bags.

attributes.title: Packing Efficiency
attributes.description: From the calculation the average packing efficiency for the sample period was 85.87 crates per as illustrated on table below
attributes.recommendation: The branch management should schedule the right number of production slices to match the amount of   work available in any given shift.
attributes.effect: Failing to achieve the set target of 97 crates per slicer resulted in an increase of the packing cost by Ksh.32,832.00. This reduces the profit.

value: We had instances of slicing machine breakdowns that slowed down the packing process, therefore resulting in extra packers noted.

More efforts to be emphasized in the slicing section to make sure targets are met within set time.

Meetings with slicers will be done to encourage them to adjust in wrapping speed.
In prior audit packing efficiency stood at 83.68 crates per slicers.
Previous
Packing Efficiency was computed for a period of 41 days from 1st March 2025 to 11th April 2025.
Internal audit found that the branch did not effectively and efficiently utilize labour force.
Operations/Production Department
The aim was to determine whether the set company standard of 97 crates per packer was being achieved.

attributes.title: Vehicles fuel consumption analysis
attributes.description:
From the analysis it was found that all route vehicles fuel consumption was within the set standard.

The table below illustrates the findings
attributes.recommendation: Maintain the fuel management controls within the branch.
attributes.effect: Fuel consumption of all vehicles was well controlled.

value: We fuel vehicles as per the distance cover. We will maintain the existing controls.
Manager to maintain the trend of issuing fuel according to the kilometer covered in relation to vehicle set fuel consumption
In the prior audit it was noted that all the vehicles were within the set fuel consumption standards
Previous
An analysis of fuel consumption was done for period 1st April 25 to 15th April 2025
Fuel controls in place were working effectively.
Operations/Production Department

The primary objectives were to evaluate compliance with fuel efficiency standards, identify any areas of inefficiency, and recommend strategies for reducing fuel consumption and associated costs. The audit encompassed a comprehensive review of fuel records, maintenance logs, and related policies and procedures.

attributes.title: Generator fuel consumption analysis.
attributes.description: We found that the generator was consuming 20.91 litres of fuel for every hour ran. The consumption was within average mean consumption as per audit period as shown below.
attributes.recommendation:
Average consumption for the month of December is within the set target and branch should maintain the trend.

The branch management should ensure consistence on fuel consumption.
attributes.effect: The generator was properly controlled.

value: We normally refill according to the litres we are instructed to purchase by the transport department.
Manager is encouraged to maintain the good generator controls.
N/A
An analysis of the generator fuel consumption for a period of 15 days from 1st to 15th April 2025 was done.
Generator fuel consumption was within the set standard.
Operations/Production Department
Generator fuel consumption was within the set standard.
